snippet: Three out of 10 nonsmokers who work indoors in California said in a recent survey that they had recently breathed other people's tobacco smoke on the job.   California has more ordinances restricting workplace smoking than other states, so nonsmok...
lead_paragraph: Three out of 10 nonsmokers who work indoors in California said in a recent survey that they had recently breathed other people's tobacco smoke on the job. California has more ordinances restricting workplace smoking than other states, so nonsmokers' exposure in the rest of the country is likely to be even greater, said Dr. John P. Pierce, the head of cancer prevention and control at the Cancer Center of the University of California at San Diego.

headline.main: Many Californians Face Smoke of Others
